description: From Spanish nopal, from Classical Nahuatl nohpalli (“Opuntia cactus”). Compare nopales.

entries.meaning: A prickly pear cactus from the genus Opuntia, especially Opuntia cochinellifera; the edible pads (fleshy leaves) of the cactus, considered as food.
examples: Nopal is a prickly pear native to arid areas of North and South America. […] Nopal is high in fiber, vitamins, protein, and mucilage.
